page.title: 01East of Stramraer
page.content: East of Stramraer from Innermessan to Lochinch. On the extreme west the sea-coast of Loch Ryan cust slightly into the block. Moving eastwards the terrain is composed of rolling fields of arable and grazing land. The majority of the block lies on the isthmus which connects the Rhins to the Machars and is only slightly above sea level. In the southeast corner lies Stair Estates with Lochinch Castle situated between the White and Black Lochs. This area is heavily wooded with mainly deciduous trees in contrast to the western area which has few tres. To the extreme east the land rises in hills which are almost covered wih conifer plantations (highest point 193 metres in square 4). There are ten farms in the are and a number of cottages roun Lochinch
